HDG.ID.content: [by Stambaugh] German idealists place identity in center of their thought, not concerned w/ simple unity of thing w/ itself, but w/ mediated syntheses of subject/object
HDG.ID.linkedContent: [by Stambaugh] German idealists place identity in center of their thought, not concerned w/ simple unity of thing w/ itself, but w/ mediated syntheses of subject/object

HDG.FS.content: formal logic foundation of transcendental logic? or vice versa? > difference/relation btwn formal Logic/transcendental Logic = difference/relation btwn ordinary principle/speculative principle (Satz) [on difficulty of determining highest principle in Fichte, that of identity or that of positing non-Ego?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: formal logic foundation of transcendental logic? or vice versa? > difference/relation btwn formal Logic/transcendental Logic = difference/relation btwn ordinary principle/speculative principle (Satz) [on difficulty of determining highest principle in Fichte, that of identity or that of positing non-Ego?]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general

HDG.FS.content: [indifference point?] unity of opposites as non-dichotomous, more precise than in-finite, a “positing” that is neither simple opposition or simple unity: unity that contains in itself all oppositions > Absolute is “most non-dichotomous identity”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [indifference point?] unity of opposites as non-dichotomous, more precise than in-finite, a “positing” that is neither simple opposition or simple unity: unity that contains in itself all oppositions > Absolute is “most non-dichotomous identity”

HDG.FS.content: for Heidegger, identity of being/nothing thought in departure (im Ausgang) from ontological difference [departure as from or as leaving behind? cf. 58 departure from Being] > [Hegel thinks this identity w/out concern for ontological difference]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Heidegger, identity of being/nothing thought in departure (im Ausgang) from ontological difference [departure as from or as leaving behind? cf. 58 departure from Being] > [Hegel thinks this identity w/out concern for ontological difference]

HDG.FS.content: [phono-logocentrism in Heidegger] “Principle of Identity” better heard than read
